intro: Ixora subvelutina, commonly known as the velvet ixora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of bright orange-red flowers. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal species. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Its compact growth habit makes it a popular choice for garden borders and container planting.
